javax.microedition.lcdui

Class Graphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.microedition.lcdui.Graphics

  • public final class Graphics
extends java.lang.Object
    The Graphics class provides methods for drawing shapes, text, and images onto a Canvas. It includes various constants for alignment and styles, and supports operations such as clipping, translating, and setting colors.

    Constants

    • BASELINE - Align text to the baseline.
    • BOTTOM - Align text to the bottom.
    • DOTTED - Use dotted stroke style.
    • HCENTER - Align text horizontally centered.
    • LEFT - Align text to the left.
    • RIGHT - Align text to the right.
    • SOLID - Use solid stroke style.
    • TOP - Align text to the top.
    • VCENTER - Align text vertically centered.

    Dependencies

    • Canvas - The canvas to draw on.
    • Bitmap - Represents the bitmap image.
    • Font - Represents the font used for drawing text.
    • Paint - Represents the paint used for drawing.
    • Rect - Represents a rectangle.
    • RectF - Represents a rectangle with floating point coordinates.
    • Path - Represents a geometric path.
    • Matrix - Represents a 3x3 matrix for transformations.
    • DashPathEffect - Represents a path effect for dashed lines.
    • Region - Represents a region for clipping.

    Usage

    To use the Graphics class, create an instance by passing a Canvas object. You can then call various methods to draw shapes, text, and images on the canvas.

     
 Canvas canvas = new Canvas();
 Graphics graphics = new Graphics(canvas);
 graphics.setColor(Color.RED);
 graphics.drawRect(10, 10, 100, 50);
 graphics.drawString("Hello, World!", 20, 30, Graphics.BASELINE | Graphics.HCENTER);

    Initialization

    The Graphics class initializes various static fields and matrices used for transformations and clipping.

    Methods

    The Graphics class provides methods for:

    • Clipping: clipRect(int, int, int, int), setClip(int, int, int, int)
    • Drawing shapes: drawRect(int, int, int, int), drawRoundRect(int, int, int, int, int, int), drawArc(int, int, int, int, int, int), drawLine(float, float, float, float)
    • Drawing text: drawString(String, int, int, int), drawChar(char, int, int, int), drawChars(char[], int, int, int, int, int), drawSubstring(String, int, int, int, int, int)
    • Drawing images: drawImage(Image, int, int, int), drawRegion(Image, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int)
    • Filling shapes: fillRect(int, int, int, int), fillRoundRect(int, int, int, int, int, int), fillArc(int, int, int, int, int, int), fillTriangle(int, int, int, int, int, int)
    • Setting colors and styles: setColor(int), setColor(int, int, int), setGrayScale(int), setStrokeStyle(int)
    • Transformations: translate(int, int), getXY(float, float)
    • Getting properties: getClipX(), getClipY(), getClipWidth(), getClipHeight(), getColor(), getRedComponent(), getGreenComponent(), getBlueComponent(), getGrayScale(), getFont(), getStrokeStyle(), getTranslateX(), getTranslateY()
    • Resetting: painterReset(), painterAutoReset(boolean), restCanvas()

    Exceptions

    Methods in the Graphics class may throw the following exceptions:

    • IllegalArgumentException - If an invalid argument is passed.
    • NullPointerException - If a required object is null.
    • ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If an array index is out of bounds.
